Position: Manager, Solar Performance Engineering Reporting to: Vice President, Performance EngineeringAbout StemAre you seeking a role with a Climate Tech industry leader that you can be excited and proud of as part of the clean energy transition?? Stem provides solutions that address the challenges of today’s dynamic energy market. By combining advanced energy storage solutions with Athena™, a world-class artificial intelligence (AI)-powered analytics platform, Stem enables customers and partners to optimize energy use by automatically switching between battery power, onsite generation and grid power. Stem’s solutions help enterprise customers benefit from a clean, adaptive energy infrastructure and achieve a wide variety of goals, including expense reduction, resilience, sustainability, environmental and corporate responsibility and innovation. Stem also offers full support for solar partners interested in adding storage to standalone, community or commercial solar projects – both behind and in front of the meter.Stem’s culture embodies diversity & inclusion beyond the traditional facets of gender, ethnicity, age, disabilities, and sexual orientation to include experience, personality, communication, workstyles, and more. At our core, Stem is at the momentous intersection of clean energy and software technology where diverse ideas, experiences, and professional skills converge to make the inclusive culture we have today. Together, we are turning old school thoughts about software and energy into progressive, collaborative, and innovative solutions. By joining our team, you will be collaborating with data scientists, energy experts, skilled salespeople, thought-leading executives and more from a range of backgrounds. This intersection of ideas, beliefs, and skills is what makes us unique enough to lead the world’s largest network of digitally connected energy storage systems.What we are looking for:We are seeking a successful and proven technical leader to join Stem+AlsoEnergy’s as a Manager, Solar Performance Engineering and be the lead solar analytics expert on a team with the goal of ensuring that our customers can fully understand their solar site and portfolio performance and generate actionable insights. The solar performance team will collaborate with a companion storage performance team to extend advanced analytics into the differentiating solar+storage space, with other generation types to follow.The role will be a combination of providing clients with professional services to help them understand their site performance and then leveraging that experience to build better software products that automate advanced site analysis on our Athena platform. The position will be an in-house solar performance subject matter expert and consult with sales, customer onboarding, customer success and product teams to ensure improved outcomes and repeatable processes, and to extend our strong product platform foundation.This is a new department in the company. The person who fills this role will be a creative leader and expected to work with the VP, Performance Engineering on company strategy development, cross functional initiatives and team building, while demonstrating company values and contributing to a company culture of excellence.Responsibilities:Drive development of automated and differentiated solar analytics to determine site performance and healthPerform professional services, working with clients on a regular cadence to review findings from workLeverage professional services projects as basis for working with Product teams to incorporate new functional capability and findings into automated software productsAs our top internal solar subject matter expert, inform organization on best practices in modeling, site topology, expected data sets, alarm rules, KPIs and other itemsAssist in pre-sales and customer success related efforts as neededWork with site onboarding teams to ensure a quality and consistent data foundation and processes, leading to a quality foundation for our analytics team and our customers’ independent engineersStay current on emerging technologies and trends relevant to clean energy performance engineeringRecruit, retain, and develop a high performing teamOther duties as assigned.Requirements:Master’s or PhD degree in engineeringMinimum of five (5) years solar modeling and analytics experience demonstrating increasing responsibilitiesExpert knowledge in solar systems and willingness to learn adjacent clean energy domains, especially energy storageExpertise in common data science tools and understanding of relevant packages available (Python, SQL, Jupyter, MATLAB, R, SPSS etc)Working knowledge of clean energy industry specific related tools and standards (PVSyst, pvlib, SAM, IEC61724, IEC63019, IEC61400, NERC GADS, etc)Experienced with Git and other collaboration softwareExcellent written and verbal communication skills with proven ability to communicate with various stakeholders including external clients, product development, and executivesAble to relate to both technical and non-technical audiencesManagement Skills: Emotional Intelligence, Dealing with work-related stress, Motivation, Task delegation, People management, Strategic Management, Planning, Problem-solving, Process development, InnovationProficient in standard office tools: Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Slack Job Location: Remote, will require occasional travel to the Boulder, CO., offices.All new employees hired in the United States are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to such exceptions as required by law. If hired, you will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or have an approved accommodation along with your executed offer of employment.”
Stem, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, pregnancy, religion, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
